title: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB: When executing the ShiftLeft command after replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces so that the two lines are visually indented the same, the text does not shift left as expected. It is unclear how this behavior is specified, but in the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., removing the tab). It is confusing when there is a stray space because it is not clear why the text does not shift.
EB: After replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces to visually align the two lines, executing the ShiftLeft command should shift the text left. In the first scenario, the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character (i.e., removing the tab). It should be ensured that any stray space does not interfere with the expected behavior, as it is currently confusing when the text does not shift.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same.
2. Execute the ShiftLeft command.
3. Observe that the text does not shift left as expected. Ensure any stray spaces do not interfere with the behavior.
4. It is recommended to specify the expected behavior for this scenario to avoid confusion.
